page.title: 15LOCAL NEWS IN MIDDLETON
page.content: Middleton has it's own paper the Guardian. On Friday 5th July 1985 the front page news was a knife attack hunt. A man who went to a local chip shop was stabbed. Still to do with chip shops-did you know that when you pour vinegar on your chips that in the bottle are extracts of North Sea Oil? Why put up with it when a local vinegar factory has been manufacturing vinegar for 18 years. A local vicar who has visited our school is moving to the other side of Manchester. Middleton Juniors football team have done the treble, they have won the league, league cup and the K.O cup. Will Secondary Schools be closed or will 11-16 year olds be mixed? It is a decision that hasn't been made yet by the Education Committee. Letters to the paper were on subjects like youth clubs,fluoride in water and nurseries.
